title: Outstanding Trip
text:
We met the half day tour at the railway station and was met by our guide. The information provided by our guide was very knowledgeable and she took us to many different places. The driver was excellent and careful, he stopped at many different vantage points for photos.
One hint, men wear longs, you can not get into visit in shorts.
We felt the trip was reasonable in price for the length and not having to worry about driving.

title: Watched the All blacks v Ireland
text: Wonderful atmosphere, very good service, good beer. The breakfast rolls were delicious. Good coffee. A fun time was had by all.
place: The James Joyce Irish Pub & Restaurant

title: Outstanding waterfall and gardens
text: You can walk from Terminal 1 to the Jewell. The waterfall is huge and the surrounding gardens and smaller waterfalls are awesome. Lifts take you to the 5th level quickly. Hundreds of shopping stores, supermarket in basement. No cost, but $5 if you want to walk over the top floor bridge. You do not have to eat at restaurants, there are plenty of steps and stairs you can sit on while looking at the huge waterfall. Go a bit early to the airport and have a look.

title: Quirky hotel excellent location
text:
Interesting quirky hotel, robots in lobby and in dining room. Excellent welcome, good information and continual interest shown by staff.
Lovely location on river. Good swimming pool with excellent views. Comprehensive restaurant, breakfast 2 people for $35, very substantial.
Room was on small side and we did not like the glass wall between shower and toilet and bed. There were black lines on glass, but did not like being in bed and able to see people about their ablutions. No hot water in any taps or shower.

title: Delicious Dinner lovely view
text:
We are staying at M Social so had early dinner, we had been flying all dayand night. We had a lovely caesar salad with added smoked salmon and 6 satay stix. The peanut sauce was awesome.
We enjoyed two lovely cold craft beers made on site, total 51sd and because we were staying less 20%.
Hugly recommend..lovely attentive waiting staff

title: Beautiful Tower Building
text: What a lovely building the Tower of the Winds, beautiful decorations at the top of the buildings. Interesting history, glad we went.

title: Huge amount of Meat
text:
Telis is over the road from hotel, it is the original. Not one on corner.
Meat, meat and more pork, chips and Greek salad and wine.
Was difficult to know what you were getting and what you had to pay for.waitress had little English and kept bringing Xtra things, 'for you', be careful. Not cheap as advertised we ended up paying 38e.
The food was good and very big helpings.

title: Outstanding, Awesome and Interesting
text: We brought our tickets day before at Angora gate. 30e covers Acropolis and 5 other visits. Left hotel by 8.30 to walk up, took that long. Bit misleading from Monostraki side, no signage, but keep following path and green fence. With your ticket, do not go to office, go straight to turnstiles. If you are ancient, take a stick or walking pole, was helpful. Very rough an uneven ground in parts. Wear good non slip shoes, take water none up there, saw no toilets. We spent 2.5 hours.MAdness leaving hundreds trying to get out in a small staircase. GO EARLY.

title: Outstanding visit to interest ing place
text:
We were staying at beautiful Kiato and took the train two stops to Corinth, engaged taxi at train station to the canal site and return and waiting time 20e.
A most worthwhile trip to see a spectacular man-made engineer ing feat.

title: Awesome do not miss
text:
We left our bags at bus stop, bus out of Delphi at 1.00 so you have to be organised. Takes 10 minutes to walk from town. At entrance to the complex, the museum comes first but you need to go past this, lower down to the path to purchase tickets 12e.
Walk is not to steep, lots is steps, rough in parts, take a stick. Views are amazing. The cradle of the world.
Do not miss this, go back to museum when finished.

title: Those meat balls in Tomato sauce were awesome
text:
We had been on a boat trip all day, we were so hungry. The meat balls were delicious, touch of mint, potatoes an salad, wine and complimentary ouzo
Fantastic reasonable

title: Great meal, we were hungry
text:
This was an excellent meal 30eur for two pork steak and chips, fantastic chicken skeweer and mum's cabbage salad, so good. Half litre red wine and coffee. It was great. Compliment ry grants served.
Recommend to anyone

title: Outstanding painted ceiling
text: This is a beautiful church, the deep blue and gold of the paintings are beautiful.walk up from the sea front from the far end of the town. Church was open, no charge.

title: Outstanding views
text: Took taxi up steep walk, wonderful views a large community live up there looking down on town of Berat. Old traditional buildings, the ancient bakery worth seeing. Walked back down no

title: Beautiful venue, Food average
text: We visited this awesome venue, views outstanding. Very friendly and helpful waitress. Food very average. 3 cooked meats, largest hamburger pattie, pottage was in the main potatoes in tasteless gravy. The wine was good and the gratius raki to finish was thoughtful.

title: Fantastic food
text:
We went with a group of friends 20 in all. Large number to serve but meal ready in no time at all.
Everyone enjoyed their food and were most complementary about perfect Italian food.
We all had desserts and the tiramasu was Devine.
You need to book, they are very busy.

title: A beautiful Hot Swim both inside and outside
text:
It was a lovely winters day, but the water was warm enough to swim in the pools outside and then warm up, in the large indoor hot pool.
The inside has been painted and looks very nice.
The changing rooms were clean.
The family went on the slide and enjoyed it, but said it needs some work to brighten it up.
Was good to be able to find half price tickets on line Book Me, we appreciated this as were a party of 6 adults.
Took us about 45 minutes to drive from West Auckland.

title: Outstanding Adventure Organisation by Advantour
text:
We are older travellers who were very keen to travel in Uzbeckistan, we communicated several times with Gulsanam from Advantours and the plan she suggested was very comprehensive and intriguing.
It included 9 days with 8 nights accommodation, one high speed train trip, one plane flight back to Tashkent and a personal driver for all other travel.
Although the hotels were stated to be economy, they were in fact comfortable and suitable in every way.
Most importantly the two drivers assigned to us were professional, friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us.
We had four different guides in Tashkent, Samakand, Bukhara and Khiva all of whom were well informed , excellent communicators and shared the amazing knowledge with us freely.
In summary we can not say enough about the high quality of this tour and would recommend them to anyone considering this trip. Great value for money

title: Excellent and Interesting Underground Stations
text: We went on this tour with a guide, it would be possible to do by ones self, the stations were very interesting and worthwhile visitng. Works of art and very old.

title: An Adventure by Yourself Underground
text:
We were hesitant about this underground metro trip because of the language difference. However, with some research we discovered that most of the recommended stations to visit were on the Brown Circle Line.
With some assistance at our accommodation we were able to ascertain the number of stations between each stop and the names of the stations we were to get off at.
Although there were no English names at the stations the route maps on the trains had the names of the stations on the trains which was a great help. You do not need a guide.
By doing it ourselves it cost about $3 each instead of $50 each for a guided tour.

title: Total surprise, it was all hidden behind the Kremlin Wall
text:
We had difficulty in finding the ticket office as it was not well advertised.
By going early 8.00am we we only had to wait an hour to buy the tickets. Unfortunately the tower tickets had to be purchased separately at a different time, by this stage the queues had become so long it was not practical to return the the ticket office. The same applied to the Armory.
Nevertheless the visit to the 4 cathedrals, the gardens and other buildings and gates was well worth the visit.
The size of the area within the Kremlin walls was spectacular.

title: A beautiful Garden in a hectic city
text:
This is a magic park and beautiful garden, old buildings and lake in a hectic city. There is peace and quiet, lots of people walking, dancing, playing, exercising, boating and sitting. The buildings are historical and beautiful.
Well worth a visit. Need about an hour to walk around the lake.

title: Unique small hotel with amazing service
text:
Rooms small but adequate, comfortable bed, pillows OK, bathroom excellent, room one story up, staff helped with bags. Beautiful decour
Staff very attentive.
Breakfast outstanding , great variety.
Handy to main center and resturants and shop over road.
Excellent laundry service reasonable price.

title: Superb choice of hotel in Tashkent
text:
Bedrooms were large and spacious, comfortable beds and good pillows.
Spacious bathroom with large shower with choices of shower head.
Very helpful staff speaking English.
Wifi very good.
Excellent dining room with vast buffet breakfast. We ate there twice in the evening, both meals excellent.
We arrived at midnight and the dining room still prepared a meal for us, we were the only people in the dining room.
Lovely swimming pool and beautiful grounds.
Hotel has a lift.

title: Comfortable bed in a big city
text:
Rooms are reasonable size, good bed and pillows.
Clean, good linen and towels.
Smell not good, could be wet carpet not smoking
Good counter, allowed us to check in early as we had had an all night flight.
Breakfastwide variety of Asian fair but linited European fair.
Good hotel for 3 store. Quickie Mart next door.
Would stay again. Thank you so much for letting up check in early, we were so tired.
place: Holiday Inn Express Beijing Temple Of Heaven

title: Beautiful Building Poor Service
text:
Situated in very very old Madras sa, beautiful surroundings.
Shocking bed, very uncomfortable, slept in 13 different beds in last 6 weeks, this is the worst.
Duvets had no covers, impossible to get the covers on them.
Hopeless WiFi, have to be outside
Processing of our passports took 5 hours.
Tea delivered to wrong room. No jug to make tea. Coffee out of machine in foyer silly price

title: Huge meals, good quality
text:
We ate dinner last evening, big serving, the chicken kebabs were amazing, as were the veggie ones.
Just over the road from the Amulet hotel. Good staff and good beer
Reasonable prices.

title: Very comfortable hotel, excellent staff
text:
Comfortable beds and pillows. Spacious room with sofa, desk, TV with English channel, hot water jug and tea making facilities.
Great shower.
Great when you have been travelling for a while, quick, cheap laundry facilities.
Good resturant attached, the breakfast was spectacular

title: There is much behind the wall
text:
We set off from our hotel at 8.00am, details were hard to find about where the ticket booths were.
Be careful you get in the correct queue, they are all different. They would not sell the tower climb until after 9.30, my husband did not go back as he would have had to line up again.
There are lovely grounds and 4 old old churches to visit. As time went on during the morning one tour party had 100 people, the churches were closed until people left.
When you exit you come directly into Red Square, not where you enter.
An excellent trip but go as early as you can.

title: Trouble Free Train Travel
text:
Communication with Real Russia was easy and trouble free
They booked tickets for the dates we needed and assisted with our visa by providing a detailed invitation letter.
We received our tickets as soon as they were able to be purchased.
Tickets were detailed and with the attached itinerary it was easy to locate the trains.
Emails were answered promptly, with excellent detail.
We would not hesitate to use them again.

title: Little gem in heart of historic area
text:
Small clean rooms, good bathroom, comfortable but small bed and good pillow
Fullsome breakfast, many choice
Staff helpful and will find out answers
Walk 15 minutes to Red Square, bus and metro right here
Variety of eating places, look around

title: A magic site
text: A wonderful site, seen it in many books and movies, loved seeing it in real life. Many people, lots of security. Colours are glorious. We walked from our hotel in Kitay-Good in 15 minutes

title: What grandeur and Splendour
text:
We visited from the Shop On Hop Off Bus and walked down thru a large park, the road is up so you need to get off the stop before.
The mosaics are outstanding.
place: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood

title: Glorious Splendour of Yesteryear
text:
Took number 24 bus, had purchased e-ticket prior to leaving home. Waited half an hour, just after opening.
Problem with this entrance is you start at the end and need to find your way to the Grand stairway entrance. Little signage but some attendants could give directions.
Important to find map on entering which has numbered rooms.
The place is overwhelming both in scale and grandeur.
The number of visitors by mid day were increasing by the minute and some areas very crowded.
The toilet situation was totally inadequate, they were locked for half an hour to clean which exaccerbated by the long desperate queues of people.
When we left, there were thousands queuing, the Hermitage was closed until sufficient people left to make more space.
Go early.
It is an attraction not to be missed.

title: Mind boggling amount of glorious fountains
text:
The transport, if doing it by yourself was difficult to find accurate information.
The boat did not go from the Admiralty but from the Hermitage jetty.this could be reached by bus 24 on the Nevsky Prospect.
Details about getting there and back by bus and train was nebulous.
We did boat both ways, more expensive but quick and easy.
The lower grounds and fountains exceeded expectation, they were outstanding.
Be prepared for a good deal of walking. Shame there were no maps.
If you go out of lower gardens to palace and upper gardens you have to pay again to re enter lower area.
There was food and ice creams and drinks available.

title: Outstanding Service
text:
Our driver Guneet collected us from the end of the Allegro train platform with a sign.
He had difficulty finding our small hotel, which was poorly numbered. However he persisted, ringing to hotel for directions.
He got out of the car and found the hotel and then carried our bags up for us.
Great service.

title: Comfortable hotel on edge of old city
text:
Comfortable bed, asked for Xtra pillow, supplied immediately,
Our room on ground floor, large with jug, cups ect.
Easy walk to center of old town 10 minutes. Not a great number of eating places, but those we went to were good and not as expensive off main Town Hall Square
Very helpful staff. Breakfast adequate.
Go out back gate, walk over to trams, great way to get around, you do not need Hop on Bus

title: Lovely old town, great historical buildings
text:
Take a good map, very comfortable shoes and watch the cobblestones they are hard on the feet. Plenty to see, look up not down. The small train is disappointing no commentary.
Went to a great multi media art show From Monet through Van Gough to Klimp in Sauna 1to 3.

title: A magic heart of Riga
text:
Something new around every corner, look up not down. Small cobbled streets, filled with cathedrals, churches and museums.
The Blackhead House is worthwhile to visit, such interesting history. Discount for seniors.
Visiting the 3 Brothers, a friendly man engaged us in conversation. Next thing he and his friend were playing our NZ national anthem on a tuba and horn, same for all different people.

title: A bit far out but worth it
text:
Large motel, good beds and pillows and showers
Right on tram stop 25 minutes to central city public transport
Good WiFi, bar, expensive breakfast, supermarket next door
Several resturants close by
Good lifts, good In formation

title: Outstanding,so interesting
text:
What a great place, much to learn spent 2 hours, went by boat.
No seniors price.
Cafe outside, good coffee
Children would love it

title: Excellent Service
text: Booked in NZ and had voucher for 4 trips. EASY TO FIND AT AIRPORT. Great service, would use again. GOOD PRICE.

title: 1loved the place
text:
Went by boat, very interesting. Expensive, no seniors price. Plenty to see and enjoy. All underground and found it clostrophobic, had
To leave early too many people.

title: In old town
text:
It is a hostel, very old place 4 stories, no lift. Young man carried my bag up.
Bed reasonable. Linens clean but very worn.
Kitchen facilities, nice to be able to make a cuppa.
Step outside into Dome Square.
Good information, good sized room at side very quiet, you can hear the bells.
place: Blue Bird Capsule hostel in Riga Old Town

title: Amazing beautiful place
text:
We visited this new distillery and learned the process of making gin, whiskey, vodka, we saw the small Norwegian airline bottles of gin being bottled. All processes were explained so professionally.
The lunch of local products was delicious.
Following lunch we went on a tour of the old secret NATO base, this was very interesting.

title: Tranquil place to stay
text:
Excellent stay, allowed early check in really appreciated after long trip.
Balcony room in West Hotel, not balcony in East building.
Comfortable bed and pillows.
Adequate breakfast.
Beautiful surrounds of island for walking, heritage buildings, trees and bronze statues.
Hard to find eating places, big vegetarian resturants next to Victory and walk to Lucy on Pearl river side, excellent meal.
Would recommend Victory West Hotel.

title: Outstanding old fashioned hostel
text:
We had a small twin room which although snug was comfortable.
The beds and Dunas and pillows were a good compliment to the excellent, much needed air conditioning.
The breakfast was substantial, loved the make your own muslie. We appreciated the brown bag breakfast because we were leaving early. Lovely touch were cups of tea in the common room.
Very helpful staff with bags, information and air check-in.
Location good 3 minutes from tram stop that took you any where.
Would recommend to anyone.
Forgot the great jazz record's again old school.

title: Beautiful old church
text:
This was a magnificent church, we went back in the morning as was dark the evening before.
look for the front door was beautiful work.
The stain glass windows were outstanding.
give yourself plenty of time do not rush on and out.

title: Magnificent Special Place
text:
We are older travellers so decided to stay so we did not have to rush.
There are plenty of B and B options outside the park, we stayed at Dada House.
it was too far to walk to the park but cheap TAXIS were available.
you can get a 2 day pass for a reduced amount 180kn.
Day one we went to Upper lake, Day two lower lakes
go early when the park opens
The paths and boardwalks are very narrow and people taking selfies cause difficulties as it is difficult to pass.
do not try and take pushchair, ride on toys and wheelchairs, the paths and hundreds of steps are not suitable.
take plenty of water, there is good available in different parts
It was a great day. There are boats and trains to move you to starting points. The maps and signage is excellent.

title: Comfortable Homestay
text:
This was a very comfortable homestay good sized room, comfortable bed, plenty clean bedding, jug to make tea.
The breakfast 7 EUR was huge and Boronia packed what was left for our lunch.
Long walk to Plitvice lakes, taxi reasonable price there and back.
Only one place to eat dinner walk down road, cross main road to lovely Bistro excellent meal.
Many homestays up the road, be sure to book in advance some people arrived having pushed their bags up the hill only to find all homestays were full.

title: Food was good and quick service
text:
We were staying in village, no where else to eat.
Excellent service, excellent pasta and excellent non chilled red wine.
We had pasta 35kn good serving.
We would recommend the place

title: Meal was terrible at self service
text: Chicken and potatoes, no vegs barely warm and swimming in fat was worst meal in 6 weeks travelling, there was little choice and it was around 00pm, not late.5

title: FANTASTIC Location near old town.
text:
The location is in a quiet lane 2 minutes from the old city, market, supermarket and bakery was excellent. 10 minutes from bus station and ferry dock.
Elena and her husband met us at the ferry even though it was 10pm to direct us to the room.
Be very careful when booking rooms and apartments as we thought we had an apartment but had inadvertently booked a very small room. We did however have use of a large courtyard with shade and outdoor furniture.
No breakfast but we prepared our own and ate outside.
The bed comfortable and very clean, average pillows.
Limited crockery and electric jug supplied.
Elena very friendly and helpful.
She could not assist with changing our room as she was fully booked.

title: Delicious Italian Meals
text:
Husband had shrimp scampi and I had bacon cabanara, both meals were delicious, well served, huge and flavoursome.
Service was quick and efficient and the meal freshly cooked.
Served with bread basket an we purchased small carafe of red wine which thankfully was not chilled.
Was a good price.

title: Outstanding because so different
text:
A series of organ pipes Set in the water with holes in the pathway to let the music out. When boats go by the sounds change, lovely seeing the children lying on the path with their ears on the holes.
Lots of people swimming off the steps.
Worth a visit. Just sit and take in the sites.

title: Barely worth two
text:
I had good old spargetti bologanise, miserable helping 1 teaspoon meat sauce.
My husband has a questionable rice risotto, sticky and tastless, we felt really ripped off. The glass of wine a silly price.
Never again.

title: Cramped but perfectly positioned
text:
The location was perfect in the old city near the North gate. We rang before for instructions to get there, with out which it could have been difficult.
Our room differed significantly from that advertised, it was very cramped,we could not pass each other unless one sat on the lumpy bed, clean, excellent new bathroom.
The single sheet on the double bed was clean but other bedding grubby.the staff generally were very helpful but the owner somewhat morose.
We liked the atmosphere in the old city.

title: Perfect value for money
text:
The staff were fantastic and helpful. I had a sore throat on arrival and was made a hot lemon and honey drink.
The apartment was spacious, sunny with a lovely balcony.
Spotless, well equipped kitchen and furniture.
Yes it was a walk back from town, so take a bus or taxi. The walk down was less than 10 minutes to the old city.
Walk to chairlift 15 minutes and 2 minutes to self catering grocery store and pizza Hut.
Great views

title: Awesome meal reasonable price
text:
We followed Trip Advisor reviewers excellent advice and found out where Tanja was. Go out the Main gate of the old city, turn left and walk to roundabout, cross road Tanja opposite the supermarket.
Yes, it is a huge well cooked BBQ, it is pork, chicken, sausages, chips and a mountain of salad enough for two.
Price was 17 euro with 2 small bottles of very good red wine.
A good recommendation, a bit rough and ready, out in the garden was nice.

title: Cosy and Comfortable
text:
We had difficulty when we booked hotel Komador, we booked via Trip advisor who had an agent and they would not allow us to change our booking.
We were really pleased when we arrived the staff changed our booking as requested for no cost.
The rooms were comfortable, well appointed but lacked a jug to make tea and coffee. When booking make sure you request a balcony room.
There was a good lift, excellent pool, excellent breakfast and close to the number 4 city bus.
Good swimming virtually over the road, but do not expect a Sandy beach,
The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient.
The buffet evening meal was good value.
